info.label: Backend Engineer
info.brief: **Jeremy is a focussed developer who is intrigued by the design and architecture of distributed systems. He has experience with distributed systems in Java, Scala, and Python, and has dabbled in everything from Javascript and HTML to databases and operating systems.

location.address:
Jeremy Moseley
16540 Linden Ave. N
Seattle, WA 98133

employment.summary: 2+ years experience developing and maintaining distributed systems.

history.summary: Maintain and develop a legacy system for transforming markup, as well as develop a new service for importing various types of content.
highlights: Architected and deployed a new system for importing content.

history.summary: One member of a three man team to manage the AWS system that powers the entire service. Also worked to develop internal tools to help other teams own their own infrastucture. Migrated the distributed logging system from Facebook Scribe to a Fluentd, Elasticsearch, and Kibana based system to provide better insight into the workings of the system, and allow easier and faster diagnosis of problems in the system.
highlights: Redesigned the entire distributed logging system.
Operated as a member of the emergency on-call rotation.

history.summary: Worked on the deployment of an XML database for allowing fast searches of marked up content, as well as the development of features on the core API.
highlights: Helped write complex XQuery scripts and API.

history.summary: Worked as a part-time member of a team while in school, using XQuery and XPath to maintain and develop new features for a long-term academic project run by the English department. Deisnged a mobile experience for an originally desktop browser only website, as well as used XQuery and XPath to process and transform marked up content in a variety of interesting ways, depending on how the content was being consumed.
Developed deep packet inspection (DPI) plugins for a software package that runs on network hardware.
highlights: Learned to analyze raw network traffic to extract patterns for various traffic types (HTTP, TCP, UDP, etc)

history.summary: Engineering degree focussed on software engineering and the design of software systems in various environments such as safety critical systems, distributed systems, and firmware. Included a mandatory co-op program that included 16 months of work experience, as well as a large student driven capstone project.

Graduated with honors from a hands on programming focussing on the broad topic of Computer Egnineering Technology. This included classes on design and analysis of digital circuits, assembly and repair of electrical and computer hardware, as well as programming and program design.

list.name: Scala
list.summary: Maintained legacy Scala systems as well as deisgned and deployed new systems in Scala.

list.name: Python
list.summary: Worked with a core Python API, adding features and fixing bugs.

list.name: Linux
list.summary: Have been developing software in a Linux environment since high school.

list.name: OS X
list.summary: All development at Inkling is done on OS X.

list.name: Java
list.summary: Use Java generally in the context of SCala development.

samples.title: Shoulder to Shoulder Collectibles
samples.summary: Developed in PHP on a LAMP stack in high school, for a family members brick and mortar store. This project started as a developmental learning experience, and has continued into a long term maintenance project.

samples.title: OneDuckAdventure
samples.summary: A travel type blog, using posts sourced from users that find/leave rubber ducks at interesting locations throughout the world. Still in pre-alpha stages, this project is a learning experiment for a reactive JS framework. The current implementation is build on top of MeteorJS and MongoDB.

samples.title: Autonomous Quadcopter
samples.summary: Customized an open-source autonomous flight package for a specific application. This quadcopter was designed to fly autonomously and track a moving target, while simultanously keeping a camera positioned with the target in frame at all times. Required skills in microprocessors and real time systems.

extracurricular.title: Organizational Chair
hightlights: Managed a $180,000 budget to run a 5 day event.
Successfully ran a 5 day event with 200 ateendees.

interests.name: mountain biking
interests.summary: Jeremy enjoys both cross-country and downhill mountain biking, both for the thrill and the atheltic aspect. Jeremy has enjoyed mountain biking in the BC interior, California, and Seattle areas.

interests.name: technology
interests.summary: Jeremy enjoys technology and the profound effect it has had and will continue to have on society. Jeremy is passionate about imagining the ways that technolgoy can positiviely change a person's everyday life in unobtrusive and low impact ways.
